title: Denzel Prempeh
text:
Denzel Prempeh née Denzel Agyeman-Prempeh is a Ghanaian-born <a href="gospel%20music">gospel music</a>ian and pastor. Denzel's career started in 2010 with the establishment of 'HeartbeatMusic'. He has since released two live albums, 'Tent Experience' in 2014, 'A Sound from Heaven' in 2015, an <a href="extended%20play">extended play</a>, 'Jesus medley' and four <a href="Single%20%28music%29">singles</a>,'Sweet Holy Spirit' in 2017,'Obiaa Enihor','Meni Obiaa' and 'Ayeyi' all in 2018 under the record label 'HeartbeatMusic'. He is a <a href="Reverend">reverend pastor</a> at Destiny Chapel, Mount Zion in <a href="Adenta">Adenta</a>, <a href="Accra">Accra</a>.
Early life and education.
Denzel hails from <a href="Ejisu">Ejisu</a>, <a href="Ashanti%20Region">Ashanti Region</a> and is the third of nine children born to Agyeman-Prempeh Senior. He first joined the St. Andrews Junior High School Choir where he received his <a href="basic%20education">basic education</a> and later moved to <a href="Presbyterian%20Boys%27%20Senior%20High%20School">Presbyterian Boys Senior High School</a> where he became the music director of the school <a href="choir">choir</a>. He joined the Chosen Vessel Choir whiles in <a href="University%20of%20Ghana">University of Ghana</a> and later joined the University of Ghana Mass Choir where he became the music director. In 2006, he joined the Love Project Choir under the <a href="leadership">leadership</a> of <a href="Danny%20Nettey">Danny Nettey</a> who he deemed a father and <a href="Mentorship">mentor</a>.
Personal life.
Agyeman-Premeph is married to Maame Agyeman-Prempeh with whom he has two children. He pastors at Destiny Chapel, Mount Zion in <a href="Adenta">Adenta</a>, <a href="Accra">Accra</a>.
Career.
In 2010, Denzel founded 'HeartbeatMusic' (HBM) as a <a href="Nondenominational%20Christianity">non-denominational Christian</a> music group and has since expanded to reach the United Kingdom, United States of America and (Germany) starting originally in <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>. Under the record label 'HeartbeatMusic', he has released songs including his hits, 'Come Dwell in Me', 'Healing Song', 'Sweet Holy Spirit' and 'Ayeyi'. In collaboration with 'HeartbeatMusic', he has released two live albums, 'Tent Experience' in 2014, 'A Sound from Heaven' in 2015, an extended play, 'Jesus medley' and four singles,'Sweet Holy Spirit' in 2017,'Obiaa Enihor','Meni Obiaa' and 'Ayeyi' all in 2018 for his professional career. His <a href="flagship">flagship</a> program,'Touching God's Heart' (TGH) has received a lot of publicity over the years leading to its recognition as the Best Event Management System by Shine Awards in 2017.
HeartbeatMusic Worldwide has grown into sub-ministries and organized other concerts like Just As We Are, Revelations of the Alabaster Box, and The Cross Choir. In 2017, the Heartbeat Foundation was set up to support <a href="Family">families</a> of <a href="individual">individual</a>s with <a href="cerebral%20palsy">cerebral palsy</a>.
